IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To create and produce singular theatre productions and programs.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To create and produce singular theatre productions and programs that serve the Rochester region and beyond, by illuminating the fullness of our many human experiences.
IRS990.Desc: Geva Theatre Center's primary focus is the production and presentation of professional theatre productions in its 517-seat Wilson Stage and 180-seat Fielding Stage theatres. These performances serve residents and visitors of Monroe County and the 11 surrounding counties near Rochester, New York.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Education and engagement programs are integral to the mission of the organization. Over 20,000 young people are served each year via workshops, Discovery Guides, artist-educator collaborations, attendance at theatre productions, the Geva-SUNY Brockport Alliance, and a pre-professional summer training conservatory. Geva serves patrons through Prologues, Sunday Salon talkbacks, and sign-interpreted, audio-described, and open-captioned performances.The Engagement department produces collaborative programs at Geva on- and off-site. It leads affiliations with local, regional, and national partners in connection with multiple communities and in the production of art and events.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: New play development and literary programs play an important role in the organization's service to the national field and the local community. Geva provides developmental workshops and performances for our Artists in Residence and other regional and national playwrights, both established and emerging, with an eye toward producing them in the subscription seasons. Geva's literary department provides extensive dramaturgical support and other resources to artists as they develop their voices and bodies of work.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part III, Line 12, Explanation of Other Income:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Other Income Generated by the Organization

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization has adopted investment policies for preservation of endowment assets that attempt to generate investment returns which provide both current and future financial support to the Organization. This support is board or donor designated for operations, artistic enhancement and education programs. The goal is also to achieve the maximum net total return over the long term that is commensurate with a reasonable degree of risk and to earn a rate of return over a 3 to 5-year period of at least 5 percentage points annually in excess of the inflation rate. These policies are applied to donor-restricted amounts as well as to amounts designated by the Board as quasi-endowments.
See Schedule O for the process used in determining the Executive Director's and Artistic Director's salaries.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Mary and Samuel Tilton have a family relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization's annual filing of IRS Form 990, "Return of Organization Exempt From Income Tax" requires its Board of Trustees to be aware of and review the content of this form prior to filing. Presently, the Form is prepared on our behalf by our auditors. Upon completion, it is reviewed by Geva Theatre Center's Co-CEO's and Finance Officer before being submitted to the Audit Committee and the Treasurer for review. Upon completion of this review, its approval will be a formal agenda item of the Finance Committee. Copies will be available for members of the Finance Committee, should they desire. Pre-filing approval of Form 990 will be documented in the minutes of the Finance Committee. Additionally, the full Board of Trustees is informed that the Form 990 is available to them before submitting. Should they desire to see the form, it is made available for their review with the exception of schedule B which is kept confidential. Once the internal deadline for reviewing has passed, the Form 990 is submitted to the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Before entering into agreements, the Board verifies that conflict of interest statements have been signed for any Board member whose company the Organization is doing business with, and the Finance department verifies that signed conflict of interest statements are on file.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Compensation Committee met to review the Executive Director's and Artistic Director's current salaries and benefits packages, information provided independently by Geva's Director of Finance and Operations. The Compensation Committee met again to review comparables and determine what adjustments, if any, might be considered. The Compensation Committee met a third time, this time with the Executive Director and Artistic Director, individually, to discuss the terms of their contracts. Both parties agreed that their current salary plans were fair and equitable. The review is completed by the Compensation Committee as requested by the Executive Committee and in accordance with Geva's bylaws. The changes are voted on by the Executive Committee in Executive Session and a sealed envelope with the details is kept in the official Board file.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization's governing documents are available upon request.
